# Characterization of the Mississauga Metals & Alloys (MMA) Waste Inventory
### Request for Proposal
The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC) invites qualified suppliers to submit proposals for professional services to characterize the waste contained within 18 sea containers and trailers at the former Mississauga Metals and Alloys (MMA) site, located in Brantford, Ontario.

### Scope
The scope of work includes:

* Characterizing the mixed-form waste, including liquids and solids contaminated with low-enriched uranium (LEU)
* Providing information to support the eventual disposition of the waste from the site

### Statement of Work
The complete description of the work to be completed under this requirement is outlined in Annex A of the Request for Proposal (RFP).

### Proposal Submission and Evaluation Criteria
Proponents must submit their proposals in accordance with the instructions provided in the RFP. The evaluation criteria are outlined in the RFP.

### Site Visit
A site visit is recommended to allow proponents to familiarize themselves with the work site and to answer any questions. The site visit will be held on Friday, September 9th, 2022, at 71, Middleton Street, Brantford, Ontario N3S 7X1.

### Amendment and Updates
Prosponents are responsible for monitoring the status of this solicitation and for ensuring their proposals comply with any amendments or updates to the RFP.

### Language of Document
Bids may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

### Contact Information
For all inquiries regarding this solicitation, please contact the contracting authority at the following email address: [solicitation-demandedesoumission@cnsc-ccsn.gc.ca](mailto:solicitation-demandedesoumission@cnsc-ccsn.gc.ca).
